td.style: text-align: left; vertical-align: top; border-style: solid; border-top-width: 3px;

h1.span: All East Valley Schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year due to the COVID-19 outbreak

td.p:
Please see below for information about programs and services offered during the school closure.
Not getting text messages from EVSD? Make sure to text Y to 67587

div.script:
$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_333590 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_333590 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divTabs_0","title":"Free Meals for Children ages 1-18 Updated 4/8","content":"
East Valley School District will be delivering meals to ALL children 1 to 18 years of age. East Valley school buses loaded with sack lunches will drive to these locations where children will meet the bus to pick up their grab-and-go sack lunch along with breakfast for the next day.  There is no cost for the lunch and children do not need to be students of East Valley School District.\n
\n
Please click here to see times and locations or see the list below.
\n
\n\n
Here are locations and times that meals will be served:\n
East Farms Elementary 11:00-11:30 (26203 E Rowan Newman Lake, WA 99025)    
\nTimberline Mobile Home Park 11:45-12:15 (19625 E Wellesley Otis Orchards, WA 99027) 
\nOtis Orchards Elementary 11:00-11:30 (22000 E Wellesley Otis Orchards, WA 99027) 
\nKH Grocery Market 11:45-12:15 (21121 E Wellesley Ave Otis Orchards, WA 99027)
\nCCS/Skyview Elementary 11:00-11:30 (16924 E Wellesley, Spokane Valley 99216)
\nTrentwood Elementary 11:45-12:15 (14701 E Wellesley Spokane Valley, WA 99216)
\nParkside at Mirabeau Apartments 11:00-11:30 (2820 N Cherry Spokane Valley, WA 99216)
\nRiver Rock Apartments 11:45-12:15 (12820 E Mansfield Ave Spokane Valley, WA 99216)
\nValley Mission Park 11:00-11:30 (11405 E Mission Spokane, WA 99206)
\nWhimsical Pig Apartments 11:45-12:15 (13303 E Mission Spokane Valley, WA 99216)
\nEagle Point Apartments 11:00-11:30 (2718 N Bowdish Rd Spokane Valley, WA 99206)
\nPinecroft Mobile Home Park 11:45-12:15 (11920 E Mansfield Spokane Valley, WA 99206)
\nSomerset Meadows Apartments 10:45 to 11:00 (4216 N McDonald Spokane Valley, WA 99216) 
\nPortico Fellowship Church 11:00-11:30 (11912 E Empire Spokane Valley, WA 99206)
\nMobile Home Park Dalton/McKee 11:45-12:15 (3304 N McKee Spokane Valley, WA 99216)
\n
\n\n

\n\n","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divTabs_1","title":"Free Childcare for First Responders and Healthcare workers","content":"East Valley will be providing child care for first responders and healthcare works who don't have access to other child care.  For those who requested childcare we will be contacting you directly with more information soon.
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divTabs_2","title":"Educational Resources","content":"\n
Distance Learning
\n
\n\n
East Valley School District has prepared family and student resources to support distance learning during the mandatory school closure. These weekly resources have been compiled by our grade-level teacher teams and include materials, activities, and other resources to use at home. While the primary focus is on maintaining previously learned skills, teachers have also identified key academic standards for students to learn, and will be providing these materials in the coming weeks. Teachers may also accept previously assigned work from students that was not turned in prior to school closure. The grade-level resources will be posted on this webpage and will also be distributed in hard copy at each meal-delivery site on Mondays. Teachers will continue to communicate and share materials with families and students through the school’s established platforms (Skyward, Email, Google Classroom, or Class Dojo) to ensure family access. Students in high school will receive materials primarily through direct communication from their teachers. Look for new distance learning materials each Monday throughout the length of school closures, per Governor Inslee's direction.
\n
\n\n
Please read this letter from Dr. Karen Cloninger, Assistant Superintendent, Teaching and Learning\n
 \n

\n\n\n    \n        
\n             ECEAP
\n            
\n            \n             Kindergarten
\n            
\n            \n            1st Grade
\n            
\n            \n        \n

\n            2nd Grade
\n

\n            
\n             5th Grade
\n

\n             
\n            8th Grade
\n            
\n            \n             \n            High School\n        \n        
\n             
\n            
\n            
\n            \n             \n            Technology 
\n            Resources\n        \n    \n\n
\n\n

\n\n
\n
\n\n\n    \n    \n\n

\n","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divTabs_3","title":"Letters and Communications","content":"Please click here to see general information on COVID-19 and letters that have been sent to families regarding COVID-19 and school closure.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divTabs_4","title":"Community Resources and help for families in need","content":"
The Spokesman Review has published a list of community Resources\n
Please click here for a list of resources for families in need published by The Fig Tree.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divTabs_5","title":"Need access to Internet service or computing devices?","content":"Internet Access
\nDuring this time of distance learning, Comcast is providing two free months of high speed Internet service for low income families. Application deadline is April 30th. After 60 days, there is an option to continue at the price of $9.95. To sign up, applicants can simply visit https://www.internetessentials.com. The accessible website also include the option to video chat with customer service agents in American Sign Language. There are also two dedicated phone numbers 1-855-846-8375 for English and 1-855-765-6995 for Spanish. 
\n
\nEVSD Student Home Technology Survey
\nPlease complete this survey for students in grades K-8 to provide the district with information to provide access to technology during this time of distance learning. If your child is a high school student, they should already have a laptop checked out to them. Please fill out one survey for each K-8 child. 
","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,
                        propPaneId: 'paneId', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propTitle: 'title', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propActive: 'active', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propDisabled: 'disabled', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propContent: 'content', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
    });
